title: Why your favorite self-help book sucks.
description:
The problem with self-help books is there's too much navel gazing and not enough action.

#selfhelp #markmanson #selfhelpbooks #personalgrowth #selfimprovement
tags: self help books are a waste of time
why self help books are useless
caption: false

channel_info.title: Mark Manson
channel_info.description: 3x #1 NY Times Bestselling Author. World Champion Non-Fuck-Giver.

transcription: In the world of self-help, there's a belief that a life-altering book can change everything. Maybe for you, that was even my book. But let's get real here. Self-help books aren't necessarily bringing anything new to the table. They're basically repackaging ancient wisdom from religion and philosophy into a fancy new book in the airport. The real magic lies in how these ideas are presented to the readers. Self-help concepts may seem simple on the surface, but they deal with the complex realm of emotions, making them challenging to implement. Intellectual learning can give you the illusion of progress, but it's not a substitute for genuine action. People often end up buying more books, hoping that they'll then fix this lack of action. In essence, books can be a helpful starting point, but at the end of the day, you gotta stop reading and, you know, go fucking do something.
